s.text: An LAT story reports that even while Holocaust museums and monuments increase public awareness of the event, the survivors themselves are being forgotten.
An LAT story reports that even while Holocaust museums and monuments increase public awareness of the event, the survivors themselves are being forgotten.

Pride, the pain of their memories, and red tape are making it difficult for thousands of America's 100,000 graying survivors to obtain the money and services to which they're entitled.

25 billion in assets two Swiss banks may pay to survivors this week, they must fill out forms asking them to: "Please describe, in as much detail as you can, where the Subject was from 1934 to 1945."
